channel.title: Cool places
channel.description: Well I don't really need help but i am just asking. What are the coolest places that you know in rs so i got some places that i can use for my rsps (it's aggroth btw) because, i want a new home and some places to spawn monsters, etc

item.title: Cool places
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Elrick, post:17, topic:542752”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=661627.msg4427313#msg4427313 date=1401458450]

As for as the surface world:
http://i.imgur.com/NYZg5El.png

I’d also say Lunar Isles is pretty cool.
[/quote]
Lunar Isles are pretty much dirt and snow though, IMO it wouldn’t make for anything but maybe a snow and ice themed training spot.[/quote]
What I did was make a buncha shops in the houses (and a buncha men and women (some of my players named a house “House of the Gay” because 2 men were in the same bed in that house, but that’s a different story :p)) and then make a “well” that, when clicked, you would “fall in the well” and find yourself in the training dungeon.

Read full topic

item.title: Cool places
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:

As for as the surface world:
http://i.imgur.com/NYZg5El.png
[/quote]
I’d also say Lunar Isles is pretty cool.[/quote]
Lunar Isles are pretty much dirt and snow though, IMO it wouldn’t make for anything but maybe a snow and ice themed training spot.

item.title: Cool places
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

If you check out my thread for World 901, I made a file called “Cool stuff” which had some cool NPCs and places.

Read full topic

item.title: Cool places
item.dc:creator: @xX4m4zingXx xX4m4zingXx
item.description:
@xX4m4zingXx wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:12, topic:542752”][quote author=xX4m4zingXx link=topic=661627.msg4423708#msg4423708 date=1399684267]
Ok, I will try that.

EDIT: It didn’t work, when i type ingame ::noclip then my client freezes
error:

Exception in thread "Thread-4" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 4000 at client.doWalkTo(client.java:8658) at client.mainGameProcessor(client.java:4545) at client.processGameLoop(client.java:3565) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:104) at client.run(client.java:6106) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
code

[code]if(inputString.equals("::noclip")) {
if (noclip == true){
noclip = false;
} else
noclip = true;
for(int k1 = 0; k1 < 4; k1++) {
for(int i2 = 1; i2 < 103; i2++) {
for(int k2 = 1; k2 < 103; k2++)
aClass11Array1230[k1].anIntArrayArray294[i2][k2] = 0;

							}
						}
					}[/code]

[code]private boolean doWalkTo(int i, int j, int k, int i1, int j1, int k1, int l1, int i2, int j2, boolean flag, int k2) {
byte byte0 = 104;
byte byte1 = 104;
for(int l2 = 0; l2 < byte0; l2++) {
for(int i3 = 0; i3 < byte1; i3++) {
anIntArrayArray901[l2][i3] = 0;
anIntArrayArray825[l2][i3] = 0x5f5e0ff;
}
}
int j3 = j2;
int k3 = j1;
anIntArrayArray901[j2][j1] = 99;
anIntArrayArray825[j2][j1] = 0;
int l3 = 0;
int i4 = 0;
bigX[l3] = j2;
bigY[l3++] = j1;
boolean flag1 = false;
int j4 = bigX.length;
int ai[][] = aClass11Array1230[plane].anIntArrayArray294;
while(i4 != l3)
{
j3 = bigX[i4];
k3 = bigY[i4];
i4 = (i4 + 1) % j4;
if(j3 == k2 && k3 == i2)
{
flag1 = true;
break;
}
if(i1 != 0)
{
if((i1 < 5 || i1 == 10) && aClass11Array1230[plane].method219(k2, j3, k3, j, i1 - 1, i2))
{
flag1 = true;
break;
}
if(i1 < 10 && aClass11Array1230[plane].method220(k2, i2, k3, i1 - 1, j, j3))
{
flag1 = true;
break;
}
}
if(k1 != 0 && k != 0 && aClass11Array1230[plane].method221(i2, k2, j3, k, l1, k1, k3))
{
flag1 = true;
break;
}
int l4 = anIntArrayArray825[j3][k3] + 1;
if(j3 > 0 && anIntArrayArray901[j3 - 1][k3] == 0 && (ai[j3 - 1][k3] & 0x1280108) == 0 || noclip)
{
bigX[l3] = j3 - 1;
bigY[l3] = k3;
l3 = (l3 + 1) % j4;
anIntArrayArray901[j3 - 1][k3] = 2;
anIntArrayArray825[j3 - 1][k3] = l4;
}
if(j3 < byte0 - 1 && anIntArrayArray901[j3 + 1][k3] == 0 && (ai[j3 + 1][k3] & 0x1280180) == 0 || noclip)
{
bigX[l3] = j3 + 1;
bigY[l3] = k3;
l3 = (l3 + 1) % j4;
anIntArrayArray901[j3 + 1][k3] = 8;
anIntArrayArray825[j3 + 1][k3] = l4;
}
if(k3 > 0 && anIntArrayArray901[j3][k3 - 1] == 0 && (ai[j3][k3 - 1] & 0x1280102) == 0 || noclip)
{
bigX[l3] = j3;
bigY[l3] = k3 - 1;
l3 = (l3 + 1) % j4;
anIntArrayArray901[j3][k3 - 1] = 1;
anIntArrayArray825[j3][k3 - 1] = l4;
}
if(k3 < byte1 - 1 && anIntArrayArray901[j3][k3 + 1] == 0 && (ai[j3][k3 + 1] & 0x1280120) == 0 || noclip)
{
bigX[l3] = j3;
bigY[l3] = k3 + 1;
l3 = (l3 + 1) % j4;
anIntArrayArray901[j3][k3 + 1] = 4;
anIntArrayArray825[j3][k3 + 1] = l4;
}
if(j3 > 0 && k3 > 0 && anIntArrayArray901[j3 - 1][k3 - 1] == 0 && (ai[j3 - 1][k3 - 1] & 0x128010e) == 0 && (ai[j3 - 1][k3] & 0x1280108) == 0 && (ai[j3][k3 - 1] & 0x1280102) == 0 || noclip)
{
bigX[l3] = j3 - 1;
bigY[l3] = k3 - 1;
l3 = (l3 + 1) % j4;
anIntArrayArray901[j3 - 1][k3 - 1] = 3;
anIntArrayArray825[j3 - 1][k3 - 1] = l4;
}
if(j3 < byte0 - 1 && k3 > 0 && anIntArrayArray901[j3 + 1][k3 - 1] == 0 && (ai[j3 + 1][k3 - 1] & 0x1280183) == 0 && (ai[j3 + 1][k3] & 0x1280180) == 0 && (ai[j3][k3 - 1] & 0x1280102) == 0 || noclip)
{
bigX[l3] = j3 + 1;
bigY[l3] = k3 - 1;
l3 = (l3 + 1) % j4;
anIntArrayArray901[j3 + 1][k3 - 1] = 9;
anIntArrayArray825[j3 + 1][k3 - 1] = l4;
}
if(j3 > 0 && k3 < byte1 - 1 && anIntArrayArray901[j3 - 1][k3 + 1] == 0 && (ai[j3 - 1][k3 + 1] & 0x1280138) == 0 && (ai[j3 - 1][k3] & 0x1280108) == 0 && (ai[j3][k3 + 1] & 0x1280120) == 0 || noclip)
{
bigX[l3] = j3 - 1;
bigY[l3] = k3 + 1;
l3 = (l3 + 1) % j4;
anIntArrayArray901[j3 - 1][k3 + 1] = 6;
anIntArrayArray825[j3 - 1][k3 + 1] = l4;
}
if(j3 < byte0 - 1 && k3 < byte1 - 1 && anIntArrayArray901[j3 + 1][k3 + 1] == 0 && (ai[j3 + 1][k3 + 1] & 0x12801e0) == 0 && (ai[j3 + 1][k3] & 0x1280180) == 0 && (ai[j3][k3 + 1] & 0x1280120) == 0 || noclip)
{
bigX[l3] = j3 + 1;
bigY[l3] = k3 + 1;
l3 = (l3 + 1) % j4;
anIntArrayArray901[j3 + 1][k3 + 1] = 12;
anIntArrayArray825[j3 + 1][k3 + 1] = l4;
}
}
anInt1264 = 0;
if(!flag1)
{
if(flag)
{
int i5 = 100;
for(int k5 = 1; k5 < 2; k5++)
{
for(int i6 = k2 - k5; i6 <= k2 + k5; i6++)
{
for(int l6 = i2 - k5; l6 <= i2 + k5; l6++)
if(i6 >= 0 && l6 >= 0 && i6 < 104 && l6 < 104 && anIntArrayArray825[i6][l6] < i5)
{
i5 = anIntArrayArray825[i6][l6];
j3 = i6;
k3 = l6;
anInt1264 = 1;
flag1 = true;
}

				}

				if(flag1)
					break;
			}

		}
		if(!flag1)
			return false;
	}
	i4 = 0;
	bigX[i4] = j3;
	bigY[i4++] = k3;
	int l5;
	for(int j5 = l5 = anIntArrayArray901[j3][k3]; j3 != j2 || k3 != j1; j5 = anIntArrayArray901[j3][k3])
	{
		if(j5 != l5)
		{
			l5 = j5;
			bigX[i4] = j3;
			bigY[i4++] = k3;
		}
		if((j5 & 2) != 0)
			j3++;
		else
		if((j5 & 8) != 0)
			j3--;
		if((j5 & 1) != 0)
			k3++;
		else
		if((j5 & 4) != 0)
			k3--;
	}

// if(cancelWalk) { return i4 > 0; }

	if(i4 > 0)
	{
		int k4 = i4;
		if(k4 > 25)
			k4 = 25;
		i4--;
		int k6 = bigX[i4];
		int i7 = bigY[i4];
		anInt1288 += k4;
		if(anInt1288 >= 92)
		{
			stream.createFrame(36);
			stream.writeDWord(0);
			anInt1288 = 0;
		}
		if(i == 0)
		{
			stream.createFrame(164);
			stream.writeWordBigEndian(k4 + k4 + 3);
		}
		if(i == 1)
		{
			stream.createFrame(248);
			stream.writeWordBigEndian(k4 + k4 + 3 + 14);
		}
		if(i == 2)
		{
			stream.createFrame(98);
			stream.writeWordBigEndian(k4 + k4 + 3);
		}
		stream.method433(k6 + baseX);
		destX = bigX[0];
		destY = bigY[0];
		for(int j7 = 1; j7 < k4; j7++)
		{
			i4--;
			stream.writeWordBigEndian(bigX[i4] - k6);
			stream.writeWordBigEndian(bigY[i4] - i7);
		}

		stream.method431(i7 + baseY);
		stream.method424(super.keyArray[5] != 1 ? 0 : 1);
		return true;
	}
	return i != 1;
}[/code]

[/quote]

few points here:
1: you didnt read this very well

then in your noclip method, make it alter the value of noclip instead- rather than the class11 array

2: your parenthesis were never placed.

all that i changed, was where ever the double array “ai” was checked for a 0 value, i added an (or noclip) check. (make sure you parenthesis it around the ai variables only though, do not give the whole statement an or, only the part that checks if you can walk.

3:
your not very good with boolean logic.

if (inputString.equals("::noclip")) { noclip = !noclip; }

if you looked at my code, you would notice a formating change…

if(j3 > 0 && anIntArrayArray901[j3 - 1][k3] == 0 && ((ai[j3 - 1][k3] & 0x1280108) == 0|| noclip))

notice the extra parenthesis…[/quote]

Ty, mate.
Now it works.

Read full topic

item.title: Cool places
item.dc:creator: @xX4m4zingXx xX4m4zingXx
item.description:
@xX4m4zingXx wrote:

Ok, I will try that.

EDIT: It didn’t work, when i type ingame ::noclip then my client freezes
error:

Exception in thread "Thread-4" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 4000 at client.doWalkTo(client.java:8658) at client.mainGameProcessor(client.java:4545) at client.processGameLoop(client.java:3565) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:104) at client.run(client.java:6106) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
code

[code]if(inputString.equals("::noclip")) {
if (noclip == true){

Yes there is a way.

in your doWalkTo method (client sided)

bigY[l3] = k3 - 1; l3 = (l3 + 1) % j4; anIntArrayArray901[j3][k3 - 1] = 1; anIntArrayArray825[j3][k3 - 1] = l4; } if(k3 < byte1 - 1 && anIntArrayArray901[j3][k3 + 1] == 0 && ((ai[j3][k3 + 1] & 0x1280120) == 0 || noclip)) { bigX[l3] = j3; bigY[l3] = k3 + 1; l3 = (l3 + 1) % j4; anIntArrayArray901[j3][k3 + 1] = 4; anIntArrayArray825[j3][k3 + 1] = l4; } if(j3 > 0 && k3 > 0 && anIntArrayArray901[j3 - 1][k3 - 1] == 0 && ((ai[j3 - 1][k3 - 1] & 0x128010e) == 0 && (ai[j3 - 1][k3] & 0x1280108) == 0 && (ai[j3][k3 - 1] & 0x1280102) == 0 || noclip)) { bigX[l3] = j3 - 1; bigY[l3] = k3 + 1; l3 = (l3 + 1) % j4; anIntArrayArray901[j3 - 1][k3 + 1] = 6; anIntArrayArray825[j3 - 1][k3 + 1] = l4; } if(j3 < byte0 - 1 && k3 < byte1 - 1 && anIntArrayArray901[j3 + 1][k3 + 1] == 0 && ((ai[j3 + 1][k3 + 1] & 0x12801e0) == 0 && (ai[j3 + 1][k3] & 0x1280180) == 0 && (ai[j3][k3 + 1] & 0x1280120) == 0 || noclip)) { bigX[l3] = j3 + 1; all that i changed, was where ever the double array “ai” was checked for a 0 value, i added an (or noclip) check. (make sure you parenthesis it around the ai variables only though, do not give the whole statement an or, only the part that checks if you can walk.
then add the
static boolean noclip = false;
then in your noclip method, make it alter the value of noclip instead- rather than the class11 array.
If you don’t want to take the time to understand what i changed, then stick to your method of noclip.
Also in this method of noclip, you do not have to load a new area for it to disable walking through objects.
